page.title: 01GENERAL INFORMATION
page.content: {Rosedale Abbey}is a small village surrounded by heather and bracken covered moorland. There is no Abbey but a small part of a Cistercian Priory remains .At the turn of the century it was a thriving{iron mining community. Ruins of the mines may still be seen in various parts of the Dale. Being an area of great natural beauty, many of the cottages are now holiday homes. The main{occupations}of the Dale are farming,forestry and tourism. Some of the residents commute to their places of work in Pickering, Malton and some even in to Middlesborough. Other people have work abroad and thus are able to live in the more remote areas. A small number of people have chosen to retire into the area.
